content.description: If you are climbing the Ortega waterfall this is worth driving to. The crux is right in the middle, traverse out right using 2 very awkward small crimps to gain a lie back crack on the other side of the arete. to top out search for the jugs inside the crack.
content.protection: 3 bolt top rope anchor. 2 old and one new  --- this was the anchor; now it's 3 sets of chain anchors, 2 have 7 bolts on each line and one line is  the missing bolts...
content.location: park in the bear canyon loop trail parking lot, located across the street from the candy store a couple miles down the road from the Ortega waterfall. from the north end of the lot hike north on the trail for about 5 min. you will see the route as you approach. you can't miss it, it's the first "view" you have on the trail. when you pass the hand rail veer right on a small climbers trail to the top of the climb. rap down or take the trail along the creek down.

content.description:
Low sit start on gaston flake and obvious sloper. Move up and left, swinging up and topping out with an easy mantle.

Unsure if this is an FA but its definitely a problem worth getting on.
content.location: Walk 4-5 minutes down the riverbed. As soon as you see the blue "Dank" grafitti, you'll know you've arrived.

content.description: Fun little problem that is fairly clean by the area's standards. Avoid using the boulder to the right to maximize the route.
content.protection: Can climb around to the left and put a top rope up on a boulder about 15 feet over the top of the route if you want.
content.location:
About 5 feet right of S's Bane 1.

GPS = (33.616869,-117.427534)

content.description: Short simple little problem that gets very dirty at the top.
content.protection: If you don't have a crash pad and want to put a top rope up you can climb around the left and rope into a medium sized boulder about 10 feet over the top. You will need a few long slings though.
content.location: Hike down the canyon past the bolted routes until you are under the first tree you come to. The boulder problems will be on your right. This one is the farthest left problem.

content.description: Crux is getting to the final bolt. Easy start turn into small but good crimpers leading to the crux. Good bolt placement gives good protection at the crux.
content.location: Just to the right of Route 2.

content.description: Difficulty pretty consistent throughout. Crux between the first and second bolt if you stay tight on the bolt line. Shifting right slightly makes it easier.
content.location: Just right of Route 1, 2nd route from the left end. Dirty start gives way to good climbing.

content.description: Short fun route that is quite dirty at the beginning due to the creek. Crux about half way up. I do not know the name of the route, so it is "route 1" for now.
content.location: Left most route. Dirty start gives away to fairly clean climbing.
Furthest from sport climbs on its own near a small cave. downstream from bollyblock

content.description: Starts off very easy at the bottom with large holds. The crux is about halfway up where the handholds largely disappear. Finishes to the right, meeting Annihilation Operator at the top.
content.protection: There is no protection on the climb, so you will need to climb top roped. Use Annihilation Operator to set some anchors.
content.location: Down the canyon past the Fermi Level about 30 feet. Route will be on your left while facing down the canyon. Just to the left of Annihilation Operator.

content.description: Use your body to climb the rock.
content.location: between S' Bane boulder and Bollyblock boulder

content.description: Shares the same start as The Fermi Level before venturing right about halfway up. A more exciting finish then TFL. New route so watch out for loose rock. I cleaned what I could but there may be more.
content.protection: Can either use an adjusted TR from TFL or use pro (down to .4) but the last 8 feet or so are unprotected this way.
content.location: Just to the right of The Fermi Level. Down the creek a few minutes from the main wall.

content.description: Simple but fun hand crack. Crux possibly around 10ft up, but it is a pretty sustained 5.7 throughout. Start right of the face and follow the crack up and left before finishing straight up.
content.protection: Black Diamond C4 #.4-5. Save a big cam or two for anchors at the top. There are anchors at the top, dual sling system around the bush roots.  Secure and redundant.  Thanks to whoever set it and left it for the rest of us.
content.location: About 5 minutes down the creek from the sport routes in this area. Clear hand crack on your left after climbing over some particularly large stone slabs.

content.description: Face climb just to the left of the Fermi Level. Lichen keeps stuff slick but small solid holds make this a very doable 10a.
content.protection: Use the anchors from the Fermi Level.
content.location: The face just to the left of the Fermi Level.

content.description: One move wonder. Same start as "Swing like Sultan." Instead of following up and left, opt for a far right knob and immediately exit out of arete.
content.location: 4-5 minute walk down the riverbed. As soon as you see the blue "Dank" grafitti, you've arrived.

content.description: Very dirty and simple route. However, it is a decent way to get to the top and set up a top rope climbing the nearby face.
content.protection: .75" - 3" cams. Anchors are a bit tricky at the top with no good crack and lots of bushes in the way. You can put an anchor in the crack farther down the wall and shorten the route or place a cam between the tops of two boulders sticking out of the ground about 3' over the top of the wall. Slightly sketchy either way.
content.location: Down the canyon past the Fermi Level about 30 feet. Route will be on your left while facing down the canyon.
